headline: Honeywell Isn't Going to Let a Little Breakup Ruin Its Growth Plans
summary: Then, the script flips and investors start pushing for massive companies to spin units off and "unlock value," under the theory that the various business units would perform better as focused, standalone entities.  The biggest recent story in this vein was probably General Electric, which is General Electric no longer.  It is now GE Aerospace (NYSE: GE), GE Vernova (NYSE: GEV), and GE Healthcare (NASDAQ: GEHC).
